results.title: A Case of Thiazide-Induced Hyponatremia in an Elderly Patient.
results.text_hl: She was previously taking @CHEMICAL_Famotidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015738 @@@famotidine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@, @CHEMICAL_Triamterene @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014223 @@@triamterene@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ to manage her @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@. Her medication was changed to @CHEMICAL_azilsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C521273 @@@azilsartan@@@-@CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@carvedilol@@@ one week before presentation for better management of her blood pressure.

citations.NLM: Khalid A, Asif MA, Imran M, Ali S, Khan M. A Case of Thiazide-Induced Hyponatremia in an Elderly Patient. Cureus. 2025 Jun;17(6):e86703. PMID: 40718254
citations.BibTeX: @article{40718254, title={A Case of Thiazide-Induced Hyponatremia in an Elderly Patient.}, author={Khalid A and Asif MA and Imran M and Ali S and Khan M}, journal={Cureus}, volume={17}, number={6}, pages={e86703}}

results.title: Chronic unilateral chemosis following the use of amlodipine besylate
results.text_hl: He had been treated for @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@ for the previous 5 months with once daily @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine besylate@@@/@CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ (@CHEMICAL_amlodipine_atorvastatin_drug_combination @CHEMICAL_MESH:C487936 @@@Caduet@@@) and @CHEMICAL_candesartan_cilexetil @CHEMICAL_MESH:C077793 @@@candesartan cilexetil@@@ (Atacand).

citations.NLM: Kim KH, Kim WS. Chronic unilateral chemosis following the use of amlodipine besylate BMC Ophthalmol. 2014 Oct 21;14():124. PMID: 25335530
citations.BibTeX: @article{25335530, title={Chronic unilateral chemosis following the use of amlodipine besylate}, author={Kim KH and Kim WS}, journal={BMC Ophthalmol}, volume={14}, pages={124}}

results.title: [Organoprotective and metabolic effects of S-amlodipine in patients with arterial hypertension].
results.text_hl: In addition treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@S-amlodipine@@@ for 24 weeks in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@ led to significant lowering of levels of atherogenic lipoproteins and total @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@.

citations.NLM: Iskenderov BG, Saushkina SV. [Organoprotective and metabolic effects of S-amlodipine in patients with arterial hypertension]. Kardiologiia. 2013;53(10):24-9. PMID: 24645552
citations.BibTeX: @article{24645552, title={[Organoprotective and metabolic effects of S-amlodipine in patients with arterial hypertension].}, author={Iskenderov BG and Saushkina SV}, journal={Kardiologiia}, volume={53}, number={10}, pages={24-9}}

results.title: Non-concurrent dosing attenuates the pharmacokinetic interaction between amlodipine and simvastatin.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVES: To explore if non-concurrent @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ dosing results in less drug interaction, the pharmacokinetic profiles, safety and efficacy endpoints were assessed following repeated doses of @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, co-administered concurrently or non-concurrently with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with coexisting @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Park CG, Lee H, Choi JW, Lee SJ, Kim SH, Lim HE. Non-concurrent dosing attenuates the pharmacokinetic interaction between amlodipine and simvastatin. Int J Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2010 Aug;48(8):497-503. PMID: 20650039
citations.BibTeX: @article{20650039, title={Non-concurrent dosing attenuates the pharmacokinetic interaction between amlodipine and simvastatin.}, author={Park CG and Lee H and Choi JW and Lee SJ and Kim SH and Lim HE}, journal={Int J Clin Pharmacol Ther}, volume={48}, number={8}, pages={497-503}}

results.title: Efficacy and Tolerability of Telmisartan/Amlodipine and Rosuvastatin Coadministration in Hypertensive Patients with Hyperlipidemia: A Phase III, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind Study.

results.title: Genetic algorithm guided population pharmacokinetic model development for simvastatin, concurrently or non-concurrently co-administered with amlodipine.
results.text_hl: An automated model development was performed for @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, co-administered with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ concurrently or non-concurrently (i.e., 4 hours later) in 17 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with coexisting @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Chaturvedula A, Sale ME, Lee H. Genetic algorithm guided population pharmacokinetic model development for simvastatin, concurrently or non-concurrently co-administered with amlodipine. J Clin Pharmacol. 2014 Feb;54(2):141-9. PMID: 24114976

results.title: Pharmacokinetic Drug Interactions Between Amlodipine, Valsartan, and Rosuvastatin in Healthy Volunteers.
results.text_hl: ...INTRODUCTION: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ are among the medications widely coadministered for the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@ accompanied by @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@.

results.title: Four Diseases, Two Associations, One Patient: A Case of Frontal Fibrosing Alopecia, Lichen Planus Pigmentosus, Acne Rosacea, and Morbihan Disease.
results.text_hl: Her medical history included @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@, @DISEASE_Hypothyroidism @DISEASE_MESH:D007037 @@@hypothyroidism@@@, @DISEASE_Benign_Paroxysmal_Positional_Vertigo @DISEASE_MESH:D065635 @@@benign paroxysmal positional vertigo@@@, and treated @DISEASE_Carcinoma_Ductal_Breast @DISEASE_MESH:D018270 @@@breast ductal hyperplasia@@@.

results.title: A comprehensive guidelines-based approach reduces cardiovascular risk in everyday practice: the VARO study
results.text_hl: Risk factors were treated in accordance with current national guidelines. The therapy of @<m>DISEASE_Hyperlipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006949 @@@hyperlipidemia@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ was preferentially based on @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@.

citations.NLM: Štulc T, Lánská V, Šnejdrlová M, Vrablík M, Prusíková M, Češka R. A comprehensive guidelines-based approach reduces cardiovascular risk in everyday practice: the VARO study Arch Med Sci. 2017 Jun;13(4):705-710. PMID: 28721135
